section.title: Step 1. Create a Network or a Sub-Network
section.para: Before you create a server, you create a network, and an optional subnet, that you can attach to your new server.
To create a network, you specify a name and an admin_state for your network. To create a subnet, you specify a network, an IP address, and a name for your subnet.
After you create a network, copy its network ID. You use this ID to create a subnet or attach the network to a server. After you create a subnet, copy its subnet ID for future reference.

sidebar.para:
Next step: Choose one of the following methods:
“Create a Network or Subnet with the neutron Client”
“Create a Network or Subnet with cURL”

section.title: Create a Network or Subnet with the neutron Client

procedure.title: To create a network with the neutron client

step.para:
Issue the following neutron command:
$ neutron net-create <amp>

listitem.para: The network name. In this example, the name is amp.

step.para: The command returns the response, as shown in the following output:
Copy the id value from the output. You will use this value when you create a subnet, provision your server, or perform other related activities.

procedure.title: To create a subnet and request a JSON response

step.para:
Issue the following cURL command:
$ curl -s https://dfw.servers.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/$account/subnets \ -X POST \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -H "Accept: application/json" \ -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" \ -d '{"subnets":[{"cidr":"120.1.2.0/24","ip_version":4,"network_id":"29f52c7e-6efd-4335-a14a-db77d32a2555"}]}' \ | python -m json.tool
In this cURL command, you specify several options. For information about options, see Table 2, “cURL Command-Line Options”.

Copy the id value from the output for future reference.

section.title: Create a Network or Subnet with cURL
section.para: You can request a JSON or XML response when you issue a request in a cURL command.

procedure.title: To create a network and request a JSON response

step.para:
Issue the following cURL command:
$ curl -s https://dfw.servers.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/networks \ -X POST \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -H "Accept: application/json" \ -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" \ -d '{"network": {"name": "sample_network", "admin_state_up": "false"}}' | python -m json.tool

procedure.title: To create a network and request a XML response

step.para:
Issue the following cURL command:
$ curl -i https://dfw.servers.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/networks.xml \ -X POST -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: $account" -H "Content-Type: application/xml" \ -H "Accept: application/xml" \ -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" \ -d 'network name="sample_network" admin_state_up="false"'
